src: Mesthekake tanganmu anteng kambi isih nabuh kabeh calathu kanthi bener - uga coba driji-drijimu aja kakehan obah. Kanthi cara iki, sampeyan bakal ora krasa kesel banget. Kudu dieling-eling yen sampeyan ora kudu nggunakake tenaga sing gedhe kanggo mijet kunci kuwi kaya mijet piano. Ing akordian, kanggo entuk volume tambahan, sampeyan nggunakake embusan kanthi luwih mlenet lan cepet.
mt: Hold your hand steady as you play all the notes correctly - even try to keep your fingers from wobbling. This way, you won't get frustrated. You should not use a lot of force to turn the key like you would a piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use a stronger and faster breath.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Salah sawijining masalah sing paling umum nalika nyoba ngowahi film dadi bentuk DVD yaiku overscan. Akeh TV digawe kanthi cara kanggo nyenengake masarakat umum. Kanthi alesan kuwi, kabeh sing sampeyan deleng ana TV wis diowahi. Iki digawe kanggo mesthekake menawa gambar nutup kabeh layar. Iki diarani overscan. Sayange, nalika sampeyan nggawe DVD, watesan uga bakal dikethok, lan yen vidio kasebut duwe naskah guneman kliwat cedhak mangisor, ora bakal diketokake kanthi ganep.
mt: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a film to DVD format is overscan. Many TVs are made to accommodate the general public. For this reason, everything you see on TV has been cropped. This is called overscan. However, when you make a DVD, the edges will also be cropped, and if the video has subtitles close to the bottom, they will not be cropped properly.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Rancangane wong Amerika ngandalke serangan sing diluncurke lan uga wis dirancang saka telung arah sing beda-beda. Jenderal John Cadwalder bakal nganakake sawijining serangan pengalihan nglawan garnisun Inggris ing Bordentown, supaya nutup bala pambiyantu. Jenderal James Ewing bakal ngetokake 700 pasukan sadawane kali ana ing kapal Feri Trenton, kanggo ngrebut Kalen Assunpink lan nyegah prajurit mungsuh supaya ora mlayu. Kakuwatan serangan sing utama 2.400 prajurit bakal nyebrang kali 9 mil menyang lor Trenton, banjur dipisah dadi 2 klompok, siji dipimpin Greene lan siji dipimpin Sullivan, supaya bisa gawe serangan sadurunge-subuh.
mt: American plans to attack from three different directions. General John Cadwalder will lead a feint attack against the British garrison in Bordentown, to draw off reinforcements. General James Ewing will disembark 700 troops from the ferry Trenton, to seize the Kalen Assunpink and prevent the enemy from advancing. The main attack force of 2,400 troops will cross the 9 mile long river to the north of Trenton, then split into two groups, one led by Greene and one led by Sullivan, to attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: Sawise diadopsi dening Kongres ing 4 Juli, sawijining naskah isi ditapakasmani dening Presiden Kongres John Hancock lan Sekertaris Charles Thomson banjur dikirim pirang-pirang blok adohe menyang toko percetakan John Dunlap. Liwat wayah wengi antarane 150 lan 200 salinan digawe, saiki dikenal kanthi jeneng “selebaran Dunlap”. Wacan umum sepisan saka dokumen iku yaiku dening John Nixon ing pekarangan Aula Kamardikan ing 8 Juli. Siji dikirim menyang George Washington tanggal 6 Juli, sing diwacakne menyang prajurite ning New York tanggal 9 Juli. Salinane tekan ning London tanggal 10 Agustus. 25 Selebaran Dunlap sing isih diweruhi anane iku salinan sing isih wutuh saka dokumene. Salinan tulisan tangan sing asli wis ora ana.
mt: After being adopted by Congress on July 4, a draft was handwritten by Congress President John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson and then sent several blocks away to printer John Dunlap. Between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as the “Dunlap broadsides”. The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the Independence Hall yard on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who sent it to the troops in New York on July 9. Copies reached London on August 10. 25 surviving Dunlap broadsides are believed to be the only authentic copies of the document. The original handwritten copy no longer exists.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Para panjajah kasebut, ningali kamempengan iki, uga njaluk wadyabala. Bala sing nguwatake posisi maju kalebu resimen New Hampshire kaping 1 lan 3 saka 200 wong, ana ing Kulnel John Stark lan James Reed (loro-lorone banjur dadi jendral). Anak buwahe Stark manggon ana pager ning sisih lor panggonan Penjajah. Nalika ombak surut mbukak clah ing Kali Mistik sadawane lor wetane semenanjung, ombak surut kuwi bakal langsung gawe pager kanthi tembok watu cendhek menyang lor nuju pinggirane banyu ana ing pantai sing cilik. Gridley utawa Stark nancepake tiang kira-kira 100 kaki (30 m) ing ngarep pager lan mrintahake supaya ora ana sing nembak nganti anggotane liwat.
mt: The attackers, seeing this advance, also asked for quarter. The forces in position included the 1st and 3rd regiments of New Hampshire, numbering 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (later generals). Stark's son was stationed at the north end of the fort. When the tide receded, it opened a sluice in the Mystic River along the north end of the peninsula, the receding tide would immediately make a wall of small stone blocks to the north toward the water on the small beach. Gridley or Stark ordered a 100-foot (30 m) pole to be erected in front of the wall and ordered that no one fire until the troops passed through.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: China Kuno nduweni cara sing ora biyasa kanggo nuduhke jaman;saben tingkatan China utawa saben kaluwarga sing nduweni kakuwasan kuwi dinasti sing khas. Uga ing antarane saben dinasti ana mangsa kang ora stabil saka provinsi kang dibagi. Sing paling misuwur saka periode iki yaiku jaman Telu Kerajaan sing suwene 60 taun antarane Dinasti Han lan Jin. Wanci perang sengit iki kadadeyan nalika akeh darah luhur sing rebutan tahta. Telu Krajan iku yaiku siji saka jaman-jaman paling kebak getih ing sejarah Cina Kuno ewunan wong mati berjuang kanggo lungguh ing kursi paling dhuwur ing kraton agung ing Xi’an.
mt: China has an unusual way of dating; each era or each family in power is a unique dynasty. Also within each dynasty there are periods of instability between provinces. The most famous of this period is the Three Kingdoms era, which lasted 60 years between the Han and Jin dynasties. This was a time of intense warfare as many noble families fought for the throne. The Three Kingdoms are one of the bloodiest eras in Chinese history with thousands dying in battle to sit on the highest seat in the imperial palace in Xi’an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: Koloni semut wadyabala baris munggah lan nusuh ing macem-macem fase uga. Ing fase ngumbara, semut prajurit baris nalika wengi lan mandheg kanggo kemah nalika awan. Koloni miwiti fase ngumbara nalika pangan sing cumepak kari sathithik. Nalika fase iki, koloni gawe sarang sawetara sing malih-malih saben dinane. Saben kerusuhan nomaden utawa baris iki bakal lumaku kurang luwih 17 dina.
mt: Ants in the worker caste will climb and support in various stages as well. In the foraging stage, soldier ants will march at night and camp during the day. The colony begins the foraging stage when food is scarce. During this stage, the colony builds several new nests every day. Each nomadic or marching swarm will last about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Akeh observasi ritme ing fisiologi lan tumindak kerep gumantung banget marang anane siklus endogen lan produksine liwat jam biologis. Wirama periodik, dudu mung wangsulan marang sasmita periodik saka njaba, wis dibuktekake kanthi bener kanggo umume makluk urip, kalebu bakteri, jamur, tanduran, lan kewan. Jam biologis yaiku osilator panyengkuyung mandhiri sing bakal nglanjutake wektu bebas-pit-pitan mlayu bahkan tanpa isyarat saka njaba.
mt: Many observations of rhythms in physiology and behavior depend heavily on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic waves, not just responses to external periodic stimuli, have been demonstrated for most living organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self-sustaining oscillators that will continue to run free of external cues indefinitely.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Populasi yaiku kumpulan organisme saka spesies tartamtu sajerone wilayah geografis kang ditamtokake. Nalika kabeh individu ing populasi iku identik gegayutan karo ciri fenotipe tartamtu dheweke dikenal kanthi aran monomorfik. Nalika ana individu sing nuduhake sipat-sipat tartamtu mangka dianggep dadi polimorpik.
mt: A population is a group of organisms of the same species living in the same area. When all individuals in a population are identical with respect to a particular phenotype, the population is said to be monomorphic. When there are individuals that exhibit certain traits, the population is said to be polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Plesiran sing didhasarke-alam bisa narik akeh wong sing kepingin plesir menyang alam kanthi tujuan ngamati pandhangan, kalebu wit-witan uga kewan liar. Conto kamempengan ing panggonan kalebu mburu, mancing, motret, nonton manuk, lan ngunjungi taman lan nliti babagan ekosistem. Contone ngunjungi, motret, lan sinau babagan organgatuangs ing Kalimantan.
mt: Nature-based tourism can attract many people who want to visit nature with the purpose of observing, including trees and wild animals. Examples of activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying the ecosystem. Examples include visiting, photographing, and studying orangutans in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Saben esuk, wong-wong ninggalake kutha cilik nganggo montor menyang panggonane nyambut gawe lan papasan karo wong sing panggonan nyambut gawene ana ning kutha cilik kuwi. Ing transportasi menyang-mulih sing dinamis iki saben uwong iku embuh kepiye carane isa padha sambung, lan nyengkuyung, sawijining sistem transportasi adhedhasar mobil-mobil pribadi. Kawruh saiki nuduhake manawa ekonomi karbon gedhen iki wis nolak biosfer saka salah sawijining negara kukuh sing wis ndhukung megaring manungsa sajrone rong yuta taun kepungkur.
mt: Every morning, people leave small towns on their cars to go to their jobs in larger cities and meet people whose jobs are in the small towns. In this dynamic commuting system, every person is like a link in a chain, a system of private cars. Current knowledge shows that this carbon-intensive economy has already pushed the biosphere of one of the world's most stable countries beyond its carrying capacity in the last two thousand years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Atom bisa dianggep minangka salah sawijining balok bangunan dhasar babagan saka kabeh bahan. Kabeh iki kompleks banget sing kalebu, miturut model Bohr sing wis digawe sedehana, saka punjer nukleus sing diubengi elektron, katon persis karo planet sing ngubengi srengenge - deleng Gambar 1.1. Nukleus digawe saka rong partikel - nutron lan proton. Proton duwe amot listrik positif menawi neutron ora duwe amot. Elektron duwe amot listrik negatif.
mt: An atom can be thought of as one of the basic building blocks of all matter. All this is very complex, including, according to the Bohr model made independently, from the nucleus surrounded by electrons, see Figure 1.1. The nucleus is made of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have none. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Meh kabeh komputer sing dienggo saiki didhasarke dening manipulasi informasi sing digawe kode kanthi wujut angka kembar. Angka kembar bisa nduweni rangking mung siji utawa loro, umpamane 0 utawa 1, lan angka-angka iki diarani dijit kembar - utawa bit, sing nggunakake jargon komputer.
mt: All computers used today are based on manipulating information made up of code in the form of binary digits. Binary digits can have only one or two values, such as 0 or 1, and these are called binary digits - or bits, using computer jargon.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: "Blog uga bisa ngewangi ngundhakake keterampilan nulise siswa. Sanadyan siswa kerep miwiti pengalaman bloge kanthi tata basa lan ejaan sing semrawut, anane pamaca umume ngowahi iku. Amarga siswa asring dadi pamiarsa paling seneng ngritig, panulis blog wiwit nyoba nambah tulisan supaya ora oleh kritig. Uga gawe blog “meksa para siswa supaya luwih pinter marang donya ana sekitarane.” Kabutuhan marang makani rasa kepingin mangerteni bab anyar saka para tamu iki ngilhami para siswa supaya sregep lan nyenengke (Toto, 2004). Ngeblog iku piranti sing ngilhami kolaborasi, lan nyengkuyung murid- murid kanggo ngambakake pasinaon kanthi apik sanjabaning dina sekolah tradisional. Panggunaan blog sing cocog ""bisa menehi kakuwatan marang murid dadi luwih seneng nliti lan ngritig; kanthi aktif mangsuli materi Internet, murid bisa nemtokake dunung ing kahanan tulisan wong liya lan njlentrehake wawasane dhewe babagan masalah tartamtu (Oravec, 2002)."
mt: "Blogs can also improve students' writing skills. Although students often begin their blogging experience with poor spelling and grammar, most readers will correct this. Because students are often the most avid readers, bloggers will try to improve their writing to avoid criticism. Also, blogs "force students to be more aware of the world around them." The need to understand new things from these visitors inspires students to be more curious and inquisitive (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that encourages collaboration, and supports students to improve their learning outside of the traditional school day. The use of appropriate blogs can give students the power to be more interested in reading and researching; by actively responding to Internet materials, students can find the location of other people's writings and express their own thoughts on a particular issue (Oravec, 2002)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Komunikasi asinkron nyengkutung wektu kanggo refleksi lan reaksi marang wong liya. Iki ngidinake para siswa mampu kanggo kerja kanthi cepete dheweke dhewe padha lan ngatur cepete informasi pasinaon. Sakliyane kuwi, ana wayah larangan sing luwih cepet kanthi anane kasempatan jam kerja sing luwih bisa diowah-owahi. (Bremer, 1998) Panganggone Internet lan Jaringan Luas Donya menehi kemungkinan pembelajar kanggo duwe akses marang informasi saben wektu. Siswa-siswa uga bisa nglumpukke pitakonan marang guru sak wayah-wayah lan ngarepake tanggepan kanthi cepet, tinimbang ngenteni nganti kelas langsung.
mt: Asynchronous communication allows for reflection and reaction to others. This enables students to work at their own pace and organize their learning quickly. (Bremer, 1998) The Internet and World Wide Web give students access to information at any time. Students can also collect questions for teachers at any time and expect a quick response, rather than waiting until class time.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Astana abad pertengahan tradisional wis awit suwe nginspirasi imajinasi, nyulap gambaran olahraga joust, jamuan lan kasatriyan jaman Arthur. Ngadek ing tengah-tengah reruntuhan sing umure ewon taun uga gampang kanggo nggawa pikiran menyang swara lan ambu paprangan sing wis suwe ilang, kanggo ameh krungu swara sikil jaran ing dalan watu lan kanggo ngambu rasa wedi sing munggah saka rong ing jero lemah. Nanging apa angen-angene dhewe didhasari dening kasunyatan? Pisanan kenapa astana iku dibangun? Kepriye astana kuwi dirancang lan dibangun?
mt: Medieval castles have long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousting, feasting and chivalric Arthurian times. Nestled in the midst of ruins that are centuries old, it is easy to let the mind wander to the sounds and smells of long-gone battles, to hear the clatter of horse hooves on cobblestone streets and to smell the smoke of fires rising from within the earth. But what is the reality behind the fantasy? Why was the castle built? How was the castle designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Khusus kanggo wektu iki, Kraton Kirby Muxloe minangka omah sing luwih kuwat bentenge tinimbang kraton sing sejatine. Cendhela-chendela kacane sing amba lan tembok sing tipis ora bakal bisa nahen serangan sing ditemtokake kanthi suwe, Ing taun 1480an, nalika pembangunane diwiwiti dening Ndara Hastings, negarane lumayan tentrem lan pertahanane amung dibutuhne nglawan kelompok cilik begal.
mt: For this time, Kirby Muxloe Castle is a stronger home than the actual castle. The candles are large and the walls are thin and will not withstand a siege for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and its defenses were only needed against small bands of thieves.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Kanthi owah-owahan saka puteran seprapat mil, kacepetan dadi ora pati penting lan kakukuhan dadi kabutuhan mutlak. Temtune kelas pertama setengah-miler, wong sing bisa ngalahake rong menit, mesthi duwe kwantitas cepet sing cukup, nanging ketahanan mesthi dilatih ing sakabehing bebaya. Sawetara playonan antar lantas negara nalika mangsa salju, digamblokake karo ulah raga fitnes kanggo awak bagean ndhuwur, minangka persiyapan paling apik kanggo ungsum playon.
mt: With a half-mile sprint, speed is not so important and endurance is a must. A quarter-mile runner, who can beat four minutes, will have plenty of speed, but endurance must be trained for the whole race. Some inter-country races in the winter are blocked by fitness exercises for the upper body, as the best preparation for uphill running.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Praktik gizi sing bener dhewe ora bisa ngasilne kinerja sing elit, nanging iku kanthi signifikan bisa ngaruh marang kesehatan total atlet-atlet enom. Njaga kaseimbangan tenaga kang sehat, mraktekake kebiasaan hidrasi kang efektif, lan mangerteni sawetara aspek praktek saka suplementasi bisa ngewangi atlit ngapikake performane lan ngunggahne kasenengane marang olahraga.
mt: Proper nutrition alone cannot produce elite performance, but it can significantly affect the overall health of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding some aspects of supplementation can help athletes improve their performance and enjoy their sport more.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Mlayu samadya minangka ulahraga sing murah; Nanging, ana salah pangerten babagan sawetara piranti sing dibutuhake kanggo melu. Produke bisa dituku sakbutuhe, nanging ameh kabeh bakal duwe dampak sing sithik utawa ora ana dampake marang kinerjane. Ulahragawan bisa uga rumangsa seneng karo prodhuk kasebut sanajan ora menehi piguna sing nyata.
mt: Martial arts is a cheap sport; however, there are some equipment that are required to participate. Products can be bought cheaply, but all will have little or no effect on its performance. Athletes may also enjoy the products even though they do not give any practical use.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: Pathokane MRI kuwi yaiku kadadean fisika sing diarani resonansi magnet nuklir (NMR), sing ditemokake taun 1930 dening Felix Bloch (sing nyambut gawe ana ing Universitas Stanford) lan Edward Purcell (saka Universitas Harvard). Ana resonansi iki, medan magnet lan gelombang radio nyebabke atom-atom ngirimke sinyal radio sing cilik banget. Ing taun 1970, Raymond Damadian, dhokter pangobatan lan ahli elmu panliti, nemokake dhasar kanggo nggunakake pepethan resonansi maknit minangka alat kanggo diagnosa pangobatan. Patang sasi sabanjure hak paten diwenehake, sing dadi paten kapisan kanggo perkara bidang MRI ana donya. Taun 1977, Dr. Damadian ngrampungke bangunan mesin pindai MRI “kabeh-awak”, sing dijenengi “Indomitable”.
mt: The Pathokan MRI is a physical phenomenon known as nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), discovered in 1930 by Felix Bloch (who worked at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this phenomenon, a magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to emit tiny radio signals. In 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using nuclear magnetic resonance as a medical diagnostic tool. Four years later, a patent was granted, becoming the first patent for an MRI device in the world. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed a whole-body MRI scanner, which he named "Indomitable".
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Manungsa minangka titah paling trampil ing maca pikiran wong liya. Iku tegese kita bisa ngramal kanthi sukses kanggo apa sing wong liya rasakake, maksud, percaya, mangerteni utawa pengini. Ing antarane ketrampilan iki, mangerteni karepe wong liya iku penting banget. Iku ndadekake awake dhewe bisa nerangake keambiguan sing bisa kadadean saka tumindak fisik. Contone, yen sampeyan ndeleng wong ngrusak jendhela mobil, sampeyan bisa nganggep manawa dheweke nyoba nyolong mobil wong liya. Dheweke bakal kudu diadili kanthi beda menawa dheweke kunci mobile ilang lan mobile dheweke dhewe sing coba dileboni paksa.
mt: Humans are the most successful at reading the minds of others. It means we can successfully infer what others feel, mean, believe, understand, or intend. Among these abilities, understanding what others feel is very important. It makes you able to describe ambiguities that can arise from physical actions. For example, if you see someone breaking a car window, you can infer that they are trying to steal the car. They will have to be judged differently if they are trying to break into their own car and it is missing a key.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Sanajan Al duwe sawijining konotasi sing kuat saka fiksi ilmiah, Al gawe cabang sing penting banget kanggo ilmu komputer, ngadhepi kelakuan, pasinaon lan adaptasi pinter ing jero sawijining mesin. Penelitian ana ing Al kajaba nyiptakake mesin kanggo nggarap tugas kanthi otomatis sing mbutuhake tumindak sing pinter. Contone kalebu kendhali, perancangan lan pratelan, keconggah kanggo njawab diagnosis lan pitakonan pelanggan, lan pangenalan tulisan tangan, swara lan pasuryan. Sing mengkono iku wis dadi disiplin ilmu sing beda, sing fokus marang nyedhiyani solusi kanggo masalah urip saktemene. Sistem AI saiki asring digunakake ing ekonomi, pangobatan, permesinan lan saradhadhu, amarga wis dibangun ing pirang-pirang piranti komputer omahan lan aplikasi dolanan.
mt: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI has made a major contribution to computer science, addressing intelligent behavior, learning and adaptation in the context of machines. Research in AI has produced a number of tools and techniques that can be used to solve a wide variety of problems. These tools and techniques have been applied to a wide range of fields, from economics to medicine to manufacturing and defense. AI has been built into many consumer products and entertainment applications.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Sanajan Al duwe sawijining konotasi sing kuat saka fiksi ilmiah, Al gawe cabang sing penting banget kanggo ilmu komputer, ngadhepi kelakuan, pasinaon lan adaptasi pinter ing jero sawijining mesin. Penelitian ana ing Al kajaba nyiptakake mesin kanggo nggarap tugas kanthi otomatis sing mbutuhake tumindak sing pinter. Contone kalebu kendhali, perancangan lan pratelan, keconggah kanggo njawab diagnosis lan pitakonan pelanggan, lan pangenalan tulisan tangan, swara lan pasuryan. Sing mengkono iku wis dadi disiplin ilmu sing beda, sing fokus marang nyedhiyani solusi kanggo masalah urip saktemene. Sistem AI saiki asring digunakake ing ekonomi, pangobatan, permesinan lan saradhadhu, amarga wis dibangun ing pirang-pirang piranti komputer omahan lan aplikasi dolanan.
mt: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI has made a major contribution to computer science, addressing intelligent behavior, learning and adaptation in the context of machines. Research in AI has produced a number of tools and techniques that can be used to solve a wide variety of problems. These tools and techniques have been applied to a wide range of fields, from economics to medicine to manufacturing and defense. AI has been built into many consumer products and entertainment applications.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Cara mikire konvergen yaiku teknik ngrampungake masalah sing nggabungake gagasan utawa ranah sing beda-beda kanggo nemokake solusi. Sing perlu digatekake saka cara pikir iki yaiku cepete, logika lan katelitian, uga cara mriksa kasunyatan, nggunakake maneh teknik sing wis ana, kanthi nglumpukake informasi. Faktor paling penting kanggo cara pikir iki yaiku: namung ana siji jawaban bener. Sampeyan mung mikir rong jawaban, bener utawa salah. Pikirane jinis iki gegayutan karo prosedur ilmu kawruh tartamtu utawa tata cara baku. Wong sing nduweni cara pikir kaya ngene iki bisa mikir kanthi logis, bisa ngeling-eling pola, mecahke perkara lan nggarap ujian ilmiah.
mt: Convergent thinking is a problem-solving technique that combines different ideas or domains to find a solution. What needs to be emphasized about this way of thinking is: there is only one correct answer. You are only thinking of two answers, right or wrong. This type of thinking is related to a particular scientific method or standard procedure. People who think this way can think logically, can spot patterns, break down problems and conduct scientific experiments.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Panggunaan rekaman vidio wis ngasilake panemuan penting ing tapsiran ekspresi mikro, obahing rai sing ana pirang-pirang milidetik. Kanthi khusus, dinyatakake menawa ana sing bisa nemokake menawa wong sing ngapusi kanthi napsirake mikro-ekspresi kanthi bener. Oliver Sacks, ing makalahe Sesorah Presiden, nuhake kepiye wong-wong sing ora bisa paham omongan amarga kerusakan utek sanajan mengkono isa mbiji tulusing ati kanthi akurat. Dheweke bahkan nuduhake kayata kabisan ing sajrone negesi tumindake manungsa isa uga diduweni dening kewan-kewan kayata segawon ingon.
mt: The use of video recordings has led to important discoveries in the field of micro-expressions, the fleeting changes in facial expression that last only a few milliseconds. In particular, it has been noted that it is possible to detect when someone is lying by accurately reading their micro-expressions. Oliver Sacks, in his article "The President's Speech", notes how people who cannot understand speech because of brain damage can still read lips with accuracy. He even demonstrates how chimpanzees can also be endowed with this ability.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Bebarengan karo malihe kemampuan kanggo golek wawasan lan kanggo sinau kanthi cara kaya sing disebutake ing dhuwur rata-rata dhasar ing ngendi wawasan dipikolehi uga malih. Cara kanggo entuk katrangan beda. Pidihan ora ana maneh ing pangelinge wong, nanging kasaguhan kanggo ngeling-eling tulisan dadi luwih jelas. Intine, jaman Renaissance gawe owah-owahan sing penting kanggo cara sinau lan nyebarke ilmu.
mt: Along with the decline in the ability to seek knowledge and to learn in the manner described above, the average level of knowledge also declined. The methods of obtaining information differed. The persecution of people was not changed, but the desire to conceal writings became clearer. In short, the Renaissance brought important changes to the way of learning and the spread of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: Internet nggabungke unsur komunikasi klompok lan interpersonal. Beda Karakteristik-karakteristik ing internet ngarah tumuju dimensi tambahan ing terminologi panganggone lan pendekatan gratifikasi. Tuladhane, “sinau” lan “sosialisasi” iku diusulne minangka motivasi penting kanggo nganggo internet (James et al., 1995). “Keterlibatan pribadhi” lan “sesambungan sing terus-terusan” uga diidentifikasi minangka aspek motivasi anyar dening Eighmey lan McCord (1998) nalika dheweke mriksa reaksi pemirsa marang situs web.
mt: The Internet combines elements of group and interpersonal communication. The characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in the terminology of use and approach gratification. For example, "learning" and "socialization" were suggested as important motivations for using the Internet (James et al., 1995). "Personal involvement" and "continuous connection" were also identified as new motivational aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they examined the reactions of readers to web sites.
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Gaya gotik kuwi pucuke antarane ana abad 10 - 11 lan ana abad 14. Ing wiwitan klambi iku kepengaruh banget dening budaya Byzantium ing wetan Ananging, amarga saluran komunikasi kang alon, gaya ing kulon bisa ketinggalan kanthi 25 tekan 30 taun. nuju pungkasan Abad Pertengahan Eropa sisih kulon wiwit ngembangke gayane dhewe. salah sawijine asil saka owah-owahan sing kadadeyan ana jaman iki yaiku asil saka perang salib nalika akeh wong wiwit nggunakake benik kanggo ngencengke klambi.
mt: Gothic style was popular between the 10th and 11th centuries and the 14th. In the beginning the style was heavily influenced by Byzantine culture in the east However, because of slow communication, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 years. At the end of the Middle Ages in Western Europe, styles began to develop their own. One result of the changes that occurred during this time was the result of the Crusades when many people began to use buttons to fasten their clothes.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Kita bisa miwiti urip kanthi luwih gampang kanggo lingkungan, kita bakal bisa nggabung karo gerakan lingkungan, lan kita malah bisa dadi pamempeng kanggo nyuda panandhang ing mangsa ngarep ing sawetara drajat. Iki iku mung kaya pengobatan simtomatik ing akeh kasus. Nanging, menawa kita ora mung pengen solusi sementara, mula kita kudune nemokake sumber perkara-perkarane, lan kita kudune gawe ora aktif iku kabeh. Cukup jelas menawa donya wis malih akeh amarga majune ilmu lan teknologi manungsa, lan masalah-masalah dadi tambah gedhe amarga kaluwihan populasi lan gaya urip sing boros saka manungsa.
mt: We can start our lives with a better environment, we can join the environmental movement, and we can even become leaders in reducing pollution in the future in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. But if we just want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should make it all active. It is obvious that the world has changed a lot because of human knowledge and technology, and the problems have become bigger because of the overpopulation and the wasteful lifestyle of humans.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Kwasa sing imbang iku sistem sing negara Eropa goleki kanggo njaga kedaulatan nasional saka kabeg negara Eropa. Gagasane yaiku kabeh negara Eropa kudu ngusadani nyegah siji negara dadi kuwat banget, lan mula saka kuwi pamrentahan nasional asring ganti aliansine kanggo njaga kaseimbangan. Perang Pangganten Spanyol menehi tandha perang pisanan sing masalah utamane yaiku timbang kakuwatan. Iki nandhani owah-owahan sing penting banget, amarga kakuwatan wong Eropa ora bakal nduweni alesan maneh kanggo perang sing dhasare agama. Mula, Perang Telung Puluh Taun iki bakal dadi perang sing keri dhewe sing dijenengi perang agama.
mt: The  Balance of Power is a system that European countries use to maintain national sovereignty from other European countries. The idea is that all European countries should prevent one country from becoming too powerful, and thus national governments often change alliances to maintain the balance. The Thirty Years' War gave the first war whose main issue was the balance of power. This shows a major change, because the power of Europeans will no longer have a reason to fight religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War will be a war of its own, named a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Nalika periode iki ing sejarah Eropa, Greja Katolik, sing malih dadi sugih lan digdaya, mlebu sajrone pengawasan. Luwih saka sewu taun kepungkur agama Kristen bisa ndadekake negara-negara Eropa dadi siji sanadyan basa lan kabudayane beda. I Iki kabeh ngenani kekuatan sing mangaribawani kabeh wong saka raja nganti kawula. Salah sijine prinsip agama Kristen yaiku bandha kuwi kudu digunakake kanggo nulungi wong sing kasusahan lan dhuwit gereja kuwi ana kanggo alesan kuwi. Otoritas gereja pusat wis tau menyang Roma sasuwene sewu taun lan konsentrasi kakuwatan iki lan dhuwit gawe wong akeh mikir apa prinsip iki wis dilakoni.
mt: During this period in European history, the Catholic Church, which had regained its wealth and power, came under scrutiny. More than a century ago, the Christian religion could make the European countries one despite their differences in language and culture. All this was due to the power that ran from the king to the commoner. One of the principles of the Christian religion is that the rich should help the poor and the church's money is for this reason. Church authorities had been in Rome for centuries and concentrated this power and money and many people wondered if this principle was being practiced.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Raja Louis XVI, Ratu Marie Antoniette loro anake-anake sing isih enom (Marie Theresa umur 11 taun lan Louis Charles umur patang taun) lan sedulur wanita Raja, Nyonya Elizabeth, sing keweden, ing tanggal 6 Oktober 1789 dipeksa balik menyang Paris saka Versailles dening gerombolan wanita pasar. Ing gerbong, dheweke bali menyang Paris sing diubengi karo grombolan wong sing bengok-bengok lan nyebutake incim-incim marang Raja lan Ratu. Krumunan wong meksa raja lan ratu kanggo mbukak chendela kretane amba-amba. Ing sawijining titik, ana sawijining anggota pakumpulan ngawe-awe sirah punggawa kraton sing dipateni ing Versailles ing ngarepe ratu sing kaweden.
mt: On October 6, 1789, King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young children (Marie Therese, age 11, and Louis Charles, age 4), and the King's sister, Madame Elizabeth, who was pregnant, were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In the carriage, they returned to Paris surrounded by a shouting crowd who were shouting insults at the King and Queen. The crowd forced the King and Queen to open the carriage curtains. At one point, a member of the mob struck the King's ceremonial mace, which was held in Versailles in the presence of the Queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

At one point, a member of the mob struck the King's ceremonial mace, which was held in Versailles in the presence of the Queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Sanalika sakwise pecahe pamusuhan, Inggris miwiti pamblokiran angkatan laut tumrap Jerman. Siyasat iki kabukten ampuh, lan manced pasokan militer lan sipil sing penting, sanajan pangepungan iki nglanggar undhang-undhang internasional sing ditampa kanthi umum sing diatur dening sawetara prajanjian internasional sajrone rong abad kepungkur. Inggris masang ranjau ana ing laut internasional kanggo nyegah kapal-kapal supaya ora mlebu wilayah segara, mbebayani kapal-kapal netral. Amarga ana wangsulan sing diwatesi kanggo rencana iki, Jerman ngarepake wangsulan sing padha karo perang kapal silem sing tanpa wates.
mt: After the outbreak of hostilities, England began a naval blockade against Germany. This policy was successful, and cut off vital military and civilian supplies, although the blockade violated international law accepted by general agreement set out in several international agreements over the past two centuries. England laid mines in international waters to prevent ships from entering the area, endangering neutral ships. Because there were limited provisions for this plan, Germany hoped for a similar agreement to the unrestricted submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Ana ing Amerika Serikat, ana kurang luwih 400.000 kasus Sklerosis Dobel (MS) sing wis dimangerteni, ndadekake iki dadi penyakit neurologis sing misuwur kanggo wong diwasa setengah tuwo lan sing isih nom. MS minangka lelaran sing mangaruhi sistem sarap pusat, sing kasusun saka otak, sumsum tulang mburi, lan sarap optik. Panaliten wis nemokake menawa wong wadon ping pindho luwih mungkin duwe MS tinimbang wong lanang.
mt: In the United States, there are roughly 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), making it the most common neurological disorder among adults under 50. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is composed of the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerves. Researchers have found that women are twice as likely to have MS as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Panlitian kasebut nemokake menawa depresi, rasa wedi lan kasangsaran nengahi hubungan antarane lara lan cacat ing wong kang lara nyeri boyok. Mung aruh-aruhan malapetaka, dudu depresi lan rasa wedi sing dadi syarat sesi PA terstruktur saben minggu. Wong-wong kang melu ing kegiatan reguler mbutuhne dukungan ing perkara persepsi negatif saka rasa lara njelasake bedane antara lara kronis lan rasa ora kepenak saka awak obah sing normal.
mt: The study found that depression, anxiety and relationship difficulties were associated with pain in people with chronic pain. However, the effects of trauma, not depression and anxiety, were the main factors in a structured PA session every week. People who participated in regular activities needed support in dealing with negative perceptions of pain from distinguishing between chronic pain and normal body pain.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Olahraga anggar modern dimainke ing akeh tingkatan, saka murid-murid sing sinau ing universitas nganti kompetisi tetandhingan profesional lan Olimpiade. Ulahraga iki utamane dilakokake ing bentuk tandhing, siji fencer nglawan liyane.
mt: Modern fencing is competed at many levels, from schoolchildren learning at universities to professional and Olympic competitions. This sport is primarily contested in the form of duels, one fencer against another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Kena racun saka njero bisa uga ora katon langsung. Tandhane, kayata mutah sing katon lumrah mula diagnosis langsung ora bisa ditindakake. Tandha keracunan internal sing paling katon yaiku anane wadhah obat mbukak utawa bahan kimia omahan kang ngemot racun. Priksa label kanggo pedhoman pitulungan sepisan kanggo racun pesifik iku.
mt: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Thus, for example, the presence of a blister pack may preclude direct diagnosis. The most common sign of internal poisoning is the presence of a blister pack or chemical container containing the poison. Check the label for specific guidance on handling the poison.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Kanggo mriksa kurbane, kepisan sampeyan kudu mriksa kahanan kanggo mesthekake keslametan sampeyan. Sampeyan kudu nggatekake kahanan korban nalika nyedhaki dheweke lan saben gendera abang kanthi otomatis. Yen sampeyan justru cilaka nalika nyoba nulungi, sampeyan malah bisa gawe kahanan tambah ala.
mt: To assess your risk, you must assess the situation to ensure your safety. You must check the condition of the victim when approaching them and every red flag automatically. If you are injured while trying to help, you may make the situation worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Ana pengaruh sing akeh banget saka kahanan sosial lan politik kayata gunane sistem metrik, owah-owahan saka absolutisme dadi republikanisme, nasionalisme lan keyakinan yen negara kuwi diduweni dening kabeh wong ora mung kanggo pimpinan tunggal. Uga sakwise Revolusi gaweyan iku dibukak kanggo kabeh pelamar lanang ngidini kanggo wong sing paling ambisius lan sukses duwe asil. Bab sing padha berlaku kanggo militer amarga pangkat tentara minangka gentine adhedhasar kelas dheweke padha saiki adhedhasar cailaber. Revolusi Prancis uga menehi semangat kanggo akeh wong kelas pagawe sing ditindhes ing negara liya kanggo miwiti revolusine dhewe.
mt: There were many social and political influences such as the need for a metric system, the shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief that the country was owned by all people not just a single leader. Also the French Revolution opened up to all applicants and allowed the most ambitious and successful men to have results. The same was true for the military as military rank was based on class as it is now based on seniority. The French Revolution also gave inspiration to many working class people who were oppressed in other countries to start their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Kabeh wong melu andil ing masyarakat lan nggunakake sistem transportasi. Ameh kabeh wong sambat babagan sistem transportasi. Ing negara-negara maju, sampeyan arang banget ngrungokake sesambat sing padha babagan kwalitas banyu utawa jembatan. Kenapa sistem transportasi marakake wong-wong padha sambat, kenapa sisteme gagal saben dinane? Apa insinyur transportasi iku ora kompeten? Utawa ana perkara sing luwih dhasar.
mt: Everyone participates in society and uses the transportation system. Everyone complains about the transportation system. In developed countries, you rarely hear people complain about the quality of water or bridges. Why does the transportation system make people complain, why does it fail every day? Are transportation engineers incompetent? Or is there something more fundamental?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Arus Lalu-Lintas yaiku pelajaran bab pergerakan para pengemudi individu lan kendharaan antara loro titik lan interaksi sing dheweke padha gawe siji marang liyane. Eman banget, nyinau arus lalu lintas kuwi angel amarga kabiyasane sopir ora bisa dibedheg kanthi pesthi. Untunge, para supir condhong tumindak kanthi cukup ajeg; mula, ilen-ilen lalu lintas condhong duwe salaras sing bisa dingerteni lan bisa dituduhake kanthi matematis. Kanggo nggambarake ilen-ilen lalu lintas sing luwih apik, hubungan wis ditetepake antarane telung kaanan utama: (1) ilen-ilen, (2) kapadhetan, lan (3) kacepetan. Hubungan iki mbantu gawe rencana, ngrancang lan operasi fasilitas dalan raya.
mt: Traffic flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and their interactions with each other. Very often, reading traffic flow is difficult because drivers cannot be easily distinguished. However, drivers generally behave in a predictable manner; therefore, traffic flow can be described and modeled mathematically. To better describe traffic flow, relationships have been established among three main states: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in planning, designing, and operating highway facilities.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Eksperimen Harshey lan Chase iku salah sawijining unsur-unsur utama menawa DNA iku sawijining bahan genetik. Hershey lan Chase nggunakake fag, utawa virus, kanggo nandurke DNAne dhewe menyang bakteri. Dheweke gawe pacoban pindho nandhani DNA fag kanthi fosfor radioaktif utawa protein fag kanthi sulfur radioaktif.
mt: The Hershey-Chase experiment was one of the key experiments that proved that DNA is the genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phage, or viruses, to infect bacteria with their own DNA. They performed two experiments to determine whether the phage DNA contained radioactive phosphorus or the phage protein contained radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Mutasi bisa duwe macem efek sing beda-beda gumantung saka jinis mutasi, tegese bahan genetik sing kena pangaruh lan apa sel sing kena pangaruh yaiku sel-sel kuman-garis. Namung mutasi ing njero sel organisme-multiseluler sing bisa diteruske menyang anak, lan mutasi ning panggonan liyane bisa nyebabke kanker utawa sel mati.
mt: Mutations can have a variety of effects depending on the type of mutation, the affected genetic material, and the affected cell type. However, mutations within the germ cells of a multicellular organism can be passed to offspring. These mutations may be transmitted in a stable manner to subsequent generations (they are heritable), or they may be acquired by an individual in its own lifetime, either somatically in body cells or germ cells (see Somatic mosaicism). Mutations in somatic cells (for example, building up of mutations in cells of the immune system and other white blood cells over a lifetime) are not heritable and usually have no effect on reproduction, but may affect the well-being of the individual in the lifetime.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Wedhus delokane wis dijinakake pisanan kanthi kasar 10.000 tahun kepungkur ing Pegunungan Zagros ing Iran. Kabudayan lan suku kuna kuwi wiwit njaga supaya gampang golek dalan kanggo golek susu, rambut, daging, lan kulit. Wedhus umahan umume disimpen ing klompok kewan sing kluyuran ing gumuk-gumuk utawa dhaerah-dhaerah liyane, sing asring dijaga dening para pangon wedhus sing asring bocah utawa remaja, meh padha karo pangon sing umume dikenal. Cara angon iki isih digunakake nganti saiki.
mt: 10,000 years ago, domesticated cattle were first tamed in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. This ancient culture began to keep easy to find the road to find milk, hair, meat, and skin. Cattle usually kept in groups of hoofed animals in the hills or other areas, which are often guarded by cattle herders who are usually children or teenagers, much like the herders are usually known. This method of herding is still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golf iku dolanan sing pemaine nggunakake penthung kanggo nuthuk bal menyang bolongan. Wolu welas rongan dimainke nalika puteran reguler, kanthi pemain biasane miwiti ing rongan kepisan ing lapangan lan ngrampungake ing ke wolu welas. Pemain sing njupuk anteman paling sithik, utawa ayunan saka klub, kanggo ngrampungake kursus menang. Dolanan iki dilakokne ana ning ndhuwur suket, suket sing cedhak bolongan dikethok luwih cendhek lan diarani si ijo.
mt: Golf is a game played with clubs to hit a ball into a hole. Nine holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting at the first hole on the course and finishing at the ninth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on a grassy surface, with the grass near the hole being cut shorter and being called the green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Tujuan utamane ilmu sains iku kanggo nerangake kepriye cara kerjane donya iki saka metode ilmiah. Metode iki nyatane nuntun panlitian paling ilmiah. Ora mung siji kuwi, uji coba, lan uji coba yaiku cara sing digunakake kanggo mbuwang siji utawa luwih akeh hipotesis sing bisa kadadeyan, gawe pitakonan, lan gawe pengamatan uga nuntun penelitian ilmiah.
mt: The main purpose of science is to describe how this world works from a scientific method. This method leads to the most scientific research. Not only that, experiments, and experiments are used to eliminate one or more hypotheses that can occur, make questions, and make observations also lead to scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Tornado ngrusak papan sing cilik dibandhingake karo lesus ampuh liyane, nanging iku padha bisa ngrusak apa wae ing lintasane. Lesus kuwi nyabut oyote wit-witan, nyuwek papan saka gedhung, lan ngumbulake montor menyang langit. Rong persen lesus sing paling medeni bisa kedadeyan luwih saka telung jam. Badai monster iku duwe cepet nganti 480 kilometer/jam (133 meter/detik; 300 meter per jam).
mt: A tornado can devastate a small town compared to other powerful storms, but it can devastate anything in its path. Tornadoes rip up trees, tear down buildings, and lift cars into the air. Six percent of the most intense tornadoes can last more than three hours. Monster storms can reach speeds of 480 kilometers per hour (133 meters per second; 300 miles per hour).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Tornado ngrusak papan sing cilik dibandhingake karo lesus ampuh liyane, nanging iku padha bisa ngrusak apa wae ing lintasane. Lesus kuwi nyabut oyote wit-witan, nyuwek papan saka gedhung, lan ngumbulake montor menyang langit. Rong persen lesus sing paling medeni bisa kedadeyan luwih saka telung jam. Badai monster iku duwe cepet nganti 480 kilometer/jam (133 meter/detik; 300 meter per jam).
mt: A tornado can devastate a small town compared to other powerful storms, but it can devastate anything in its path. Tornadoes rip up trees, tear down buildings, and lift cars into the air. Six percent of the most intense tornadoes can last more than three hours. Monster storms can reach speeds of 480 kilometers per hour (133 meters per second; 300 miles per hour).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Manungsa wis gawe lan migunakake lensa kanggo nggedhekake kanggo ewon-ewon taun. Ananging, teleskop tenanan kang sepisan digawe ing Eropa ing pungkasan abad 16. Teleskop- teleskop iki nggunakake gabungan loro lensa kanggo gawe objek-objek sing adoh katon luwih cerak lan gedhe.
mt: People have used lenses to magnify objects for thousands of years. However, the first refracting telescope was made in Europe at the end of the 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear larger and brighter.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: Muhammad biyen minat banget marang perkara-perkara sing ana ing sak njabane urip ning donya iki. Dheweke asring banget menyang guwo sing saiki dikenal dadi Guwo “Hira’” ana ing Gunung “Noor” (cahya) kanggo semedi. Dheweke ing guwa dhewe, sing slamet nalika iku, menehi gambaran sing cetha banget ngenani kecenderungan spiritual Muhammad. Leren ana ning pucuk salah sawijine gunung sing ana sisih lor Mekah, guwa iki sepi banget saka donya njaba. Saktenane, ora gampang kanggo nemokake sanadyan wis ngerti anane. Sanalikane ing jero guwa, iku pengasingan total. Ora ana sing bisa ditiliki sakliyane langit sing endah, bening ana ndhuwur lan akeh gunung sakubengane. Ora akeh bageyan saka ndonya iki sing bisa dideleng utawa dirungokake saka njero guwa.
mt: Muhammad was always interested in things outside his life in this world. He often went to the cave now known as the Hira' cave on Mount Noor (light) for meditation. He was alone in the cave at the time, and gave a clear description of Muhammad's spiritual inclinations.  On the summit of one of the mountains north of Mecca, this cave is very isolated from the outside world. It is not easy to find, even if you know where it is. Inside the cave, it is total isolation. There is nothing to be seen or heard above the clear sky, the bright blue above and many mountains around. Not much of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Dalan gerobak dibangun ing Inggris paling cepet abad kaping 16. Sanajan rel sepur grobag mung kasusun saka papan kayu sing sejajar, bisa nggawe jaran narik grobag supaya bisa luwih cepet lan narik beban luwih gedhe tinimbang ing dalan sing rada kasar. Bantalan rel dikenalne rada awal kanggo nahan rel ing panggone. Nanging saya suwe, saya dimangerteni menawa rel bakal luwih efisien menawa duweni wesi ing dhuwure. Iki dadi praktik umum, nanging wesine nyebabake panganggo luwih akeh ing perangan roda kayu kreta. Pungkasan, rodha kayu diganti rodha wesi. Ing taun 1767, rel sing digawe kabeh saka wesi kapisan dikenalke.
mt: The first roads in England were built in the 16th century. Although the railway tracks were originally made of wooden planks, they could make horses pull faster and carry heavier loads than on rough roads. Wooden rails were known to be early for holding the rails in place. However, it was later realized that rails would be more efficient if they had iron on top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the carts. Finally, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first all-iron rails were first known.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
