src: Gaya sastra romantis duwe unsur determinisme budaya sing akeh, kagambar saka penulis kayata Goethe, Fichte, lan Schlegel. Ing konteks Romantisisme, geografi mbentuk individu, lan suwe-suwe adat lan budaya sing ana gandhengane karo geografi kasebut muncul, lan iki, selaras karo papan masarakat, luwih becik tinimbang ukum sing dipeksa kanthi sewenang-wenang.
mt: Romantic literature has a strong element of cultural determinism, illustrated by writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, geography shapes individuals, and over time customs and culture associated with that geography emerge, and this, in line with the place of society, is better than laws imposed arbitrarily.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: "Determinasi teknologi yaiku ukara sing nuduhake akeh pikiran kanggo praktek, saka dhukungan-teknologi utawa teknologi sing kudu ana nganti rasa sing kuwat yen nasib manungsa kuwi didhukung dening pikiran sing dadi dhasar dihubungke karo aturan ilmiah lan manifestasine kanggo teknologi. Umume tapsiran babagan determinisme teknologi duwe rong panemu umum: manawa pangembangan teknologi dhewe nderek jalur sing umume ora ana pangaruh budaya utawa politik, lan teknologi kasebut uga duwe ""efek"" kanggo masarakat sing nunggal, tinimbang didadekake kanthi kahanan sosial. Umpamane, ana sing bakal ngendikan yen mesin kuwi dadi cikal bakal anungsa ambangun dalan. Nanging, jaringan dalan nasional ora patut kanthi ekonomi mung kanggo sawetara mobil, mula cara produksi anyar dikembangake kanggo nyuda beya panduwe mobil. Nduweni mobil massa uga nyebabake luwih akeh kacilakan ing dalan-dalan, sing nyiptakake teknik anyar kanggo ngrumat kasarasan lan ndandani awak mobil rusak."
mt: "Determinism of technology is a term that describes many thoughts for practice, from technology support or technology that must exist until the strong feeling that human fate is supported by thoughts that are connected to scientific rules and manifested for technology. Generally, the conception of technology determinism has two common perceptions: whether the development of technology itself is on the usual path without cultural or political influence, and that technology also has ""effects"" for society, rather than being made with social conditions. For example, there will be those who will say that machines are the basis of human road construction. However, the national road network is not only for some cars, so new production methods are developed to reduce the cost of driving cars. Having mass cars also causes more accidents on the roads, creating new techniques to reduce congestion and repair damaged car bodies."
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: "Tandha ""panah dhuwur"" katon kaya huruf V lan ""tandha panah ngisor"" kaya isi staples utawa kothak sing ilang sisih ngisor. Munggah tegese sampeyan kudu miwiti saka pucuk lan nyurung gendhewa, lan mudhun tegese sampeyan kudu miwiti saka kodhok (ing ngendi tangan sampeyan nyekel gendhewa) lan narik gendhewa kasebut. Lengkungan ana ndhuwur notasi iki biyasane ngasilke swara sing luwih alus, lan tandha centhang ning ndhuwure notasi iki biyasane ngasilke swara sing luwih kuwat lan tegas. Aja mamang nulis ing tandhamu dhewe, nanging elinga tandha sudhut mlengkung sing ana amarga musik, mula biasane kudu diurmati."
mt: "The 'up arrow' looks like the letter V and the 'down arrow' like a staple or a box with the bottom cut out. Up means you should start from the top and pull the bowstring, and down means you should start from the bottom (where your hand holds the bowstring) and draw the bowstring. The curve above the notations usually produces a smoother sound, and the dot above the notations usually produces a louder and more forceful sound. Don't write in your own notes, but pay attention to the curved dots because of the music, so they should be respected."
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: Ora kaya primata liyane, klompok hominid ora nggunakake tangane maneh kanggo obah utawa nahan barang sing abot utawa gandhulan ana ning wit-witan. Tangan lan sikil simpanse duwe ukuran lan dawa sing padha, sing nuduhake panggunaan tangan kanggo nahan bobot nalika mlaku nganggo ros-rosan driji. Tangan menungsa iku luwih cendhak tinimbang sikile, kanthi balung jenthik sing luwih lurus. Fosil balung tangan loro yuta taun tekan telung yuta taun ngatonake ewahing iki ing spesialisasi tangan iku saka daya penggerak dadi manipulasi.
mt: Unlike other primates, hominids do not use their hands for locomotion or to hold or support heavy objects or infants while walking on two legs. The hands and feet of chimpanzees have the same size and length, indicating the use of hands to support weight while walking on knuckles. The human hand is smaller than the feet, with slender bones and more straight. Two million to three million year old fossil bones show this change in the specialization of the hand from power to manipulation.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: Panliten abad rong puluhan wis nuduhake manawa ana rong kumpulan jinis genetik: didhelikake lan dituduhake. Mutasi nambah variasi genetik anyar, lan seleksi ngilangake iki saka kelompok variasi sing diungkapake. Segregasi lan rekombinasi jinis acak bolak balik antarane rong kelompok kanthi saben generasi.
mt: 20th century geneticists discovered that there are two types of genetic groups: inbred and outbred. Mutations add new genetic variation, and selection removes this from the revealed group. Segregation and random recombinations between two groups with each generation.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: Ing sabana, angel kanggo primata kanthi sistem pencernaan sing kaya manungsa kanggo muasakae kebutuhan asam aminone saka sumber tanduran sing kasadhiya. Apa maneh, rasa gagal kaya ngono kuwi ngasilake perkara sing tenanan: depresi, kurang nutrisi, lan pungksane mati. Sumber daya tetanduran sing paling gampang diakses yaiku protein sing bisa dijukuk kanthi gampang ning njero godhong lan polong-polongan, nanging tetanduran iki angel banget dicerna dening primata kayata manungsa kajaba tetanduran kuwi dimasak. Sawalike, panganan kewan (semut, rayap, endhog) ora mung gampang dicerna, nanging iku nyawisake protein kualitas dhuwur sing isine kabeh asam amino sing dibutuhake. Sawise ditimbang, awake dhewe kudune ora kaget menawa leluhure awake dhewe ngatasi “masalah protein” kanthi cara sing padha karo sing dilakoni simpanse ana ing sabana dina iki.
mt: In the savanna, primates with a digestive system like humans for processing the amino acids from plant sources. However, this leaves a problem: depression, malnutrition, and death. The most easily accessible plant resources are proteins that can be easily digested in the leaves and pods, but these plants are difficult to digest by primates such as humans unless they are cooked. Similarly, animal food (ants, termites, eggs) is not only easy to digest, but also high-quality protein that contains all the amino acids needed. After weighing, he was not surprised that his ancestors solved the "protein problem" in the same way as the chimpanzees in the savanna today.
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Cabang kabudayan ndadekake siji wong sing duwe pikiran padha sing rumangsa ora digatekake karo drajat sosial lan bisa nuwuhake rasa identitas. Cabang kabudayan bisa dibedakake amarga umur, etnis, kelas, papan, lan/utawa jenis kelamin anggota-anggotane. Kualitas sing nemtokake sawijining cabang kabudayan mbokmenawa basa, estetika, sing ana gayutane karo agama, politik, seksual, geografis, utawa sawijining kombinasi saka faktor-faktor. Anggota saka ranting budaya asring nandhani keanggotaane kanthi nggunakake gaya sing beda lan simbolis, sing kalebu busana, prilaku, lan dialek.
mt: A cultural subgroup is a group of people who share similar ideas that are not necessarily reflected in their social status and can foster a sense of identity. Cultural subgroups can be distinguished by age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of their members. The quality that defines a cultural subgroup is usually language, aesthetics, that is associated with religion, politics, sexuality, geography, or a combination of factors. Members of cultural subgroups often indicate their membership by using distinctive styles and symbols, including dress, behavior, and dialect.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: Anak-anak ngrembakakake sawijining kesadaran ras lan stereotip rasial iki mangaribawani tumindak. Contone, bocah sing ngenali kasukon golongan cilik sing diklisekake amarga ora bisa sekolah kanthi bener mula nyondhong ora bisa sekolah kanthi bener nalika sinau babagan klise sing ana hubungane karo suku dheweke.
mt: Children who grow up with heightened racial and racial stereotypes are more likely to act on them. For example, a child who is teased for being in a small minority group may feel ostracized when learning about stereotypes that apply to their own group.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: Salah sawijine metode sing paling umum digunakake kanggo nggambarake pentinge sosialisasi yaiku manfaatke kasus-kasus sing kurang nguntungke bocah-bocah sing, ora dianggep, mesakke, sengaja disalahgunakke, ora diajak rembugan dening wong diwassa nalika isih cilik. Anak-anak kaya iku disebut “liar” utawa nakal. Saperangan anak- anak liar uwis dikurung dening wong-wong (biasane uwong tuwane dhewe); ing saperangan kasus anak-anak iki ditelantarke amarga penolakane uwong tuwa marang kerusakan intelektual utawa fisike anak sing parah. Bocah nakal kuwi bisa uga wis tau dianiaya nalika isih bocah utawa rasa wedi sadurunge ditinggal utawa sadurunge minggat. Liyane dikira digawa kewan; saperangan disebutake urip dhewe ing alam liar. Nalika dirawat dening kean dudu-manungsa, si anak nuduhake tumindak sing liar (kanthi watesan tartamtu) meh kabeh kaya perawatan kewan utamane, kayata rasa wedi lan uga rasa ora pedhuline marang manungsa.
mt: One of the most common methods of depicting child abuse is the neglect of children who, not being considered, are deliberately misused, not being invited to talk to adults when they are still children or before leaving. They are also believed to be taken by animals; some are said to live alone in the wild. When treated by non-humans, the child exhibits wild behavior (to some extent) like animal care, such as fear and also fearlessness towards humans.
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: Tetanen swasembada yaiku tetanen sing ditindakake kanggo ngasilake panganan sing cukup kanggo nyukupi kabutuhan wong tani lan kulawargane. Tetanen panguripan minangka cara sing gampang, asring organik, nggunakake wiji sing asli disimpen kanggo ecoregion sing digabungake karo rotasi panen utawa cara sing gampang kanggo nggedhekake. Sarasilah umume uwong tani akeh melu tetanen panguripan lan iki isih kedadeyan ing pirang-pirang negara berkembang.
mt: Sustained self-sufficiency is the practice of growing food to provide for the needs of the farmer and his family.  Living off the land is a simple, often organic, use of native seeds stored for the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or easy to establish.  Most farmers participate in sustainable agriculture and this is still practiced in many developing countries.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Mungkin jenis turisme sing paling umum yaiku apa sing saperangan akeh wong-wong gayutake karo lelungan: Wisata rekreasi. Iki wayahe wong lunga menyang panggon sing beda banget karo urip saben dinane supaya bisa leyeh-leyeh lan seneng-seneng. Pesisir, taman rekreasi lan papan kemah iku kerepe panggon-panggon kang paling lumrah ditekani dening turis rekreasi. Yen tujuan utamane wong sing dolan menyang panggonan tartamtu kuwi kanggo mangerteni sejarah lan kabudayane jinis plesiran sing kaya mangkene iki diarani plesiran kabudayan. Turis kuwi bisa plesir menyang tandha sing khas ana negara tartamtu utawa turis kuwi bisa milih supaya mung nggatekake sak panggonan thok.
mt: The most common type of tourism is probably what many people associate with vacations: recreational tourism. This is when people go to places that are very different from their everyday lives in order to relax and enjoy themselves. Beaches, amusement parks and campgrounds are the most common destinations for recreational tourists. If the main purpose of people going to a particular place is to learn about its history and culture, this type of tourism is called cultural tourism. Tourists can visit a country's landmarks or tourists can choose to only visit one particular place.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: Wong-wong sing wis melu kanggo sawetara dasawarsa ngewangi awake dhewe ngajeni kakuwatan lan semangate dhewe nalika ngukur angele lan uga gagale kanthi jujur. Nalika ngrungokake saben wong nuduhake crita pribadi, kulawarga, lan pakumpulan, kita entuk wawasan sing penting ing mangsa kepungkur lan sawetara kapribaden sing mangaruhi kabecikan utawa ala budaya pakumpulan. Nalika ngerti sarasilahe wong aja nganggep ngerti budayane, paling ora mbantu masarakat entuk pangerten ing pundi dheweke ana ing sarasilah pakumpulan. Nalika ngevaluasi kesuksesan lan dadi sadhar marang kegagalan, individu lan kabeh wong sing melu nemokake kanthi luwih jero nilai-nilai, misi, lan kekuatan pendhorong organisasi. Ing perkara iki, ngeling-eling prilaku wirausaha sing sadurunge lan asile bisa mbantu supaya manungsa bisa nrima owah-owahan anyar lan uga dalan anyar kanggo gereja lokal iki. Crita sukses kaya mengkono nyuda rasa wedi marang perubahan, semono uga gawe kecenderungan positif tumrap perubahan ing mangsa ngarep.
mt: People who have attended for several decades have been nourished in their own personal growth, as well as their ability to lead and inspire others. When listening to each person share their personal stories, family, and group, we gain important insights into the past and some of the unique characteristics that have shaped or influenced the culture of this local church. When evaluating success and being mindful of failure, individuals and all who attend discover with greater depth the values, mission, and driving forces of this organization. In this case, reflecting on past entrepreneurial behavior and successes can help people to accept new changes and also new avenues for this local church. Stories of success like this reduce fear of change, as well as creating a positive trend towards change in the future.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: Cara nyedhaki nalika wis moderen, kanggo nyinau nawakke kabebasan saka sing mutlak. Ora ana cara sing apik kanggo sinau. Saktemene, ora ana perkara apik siji thk sing bisa disinau. SInau kelakon ing pengalaman antarane wong sinau lan wawasan sing disuguhake. Pangalaman kita saiki karo kabeh presentasi babagan nggawe-dhewe lan katrangan, acara TV adhedhasar piwulang nggambarake bab iki. Akeh banget saka awake dhewe sing nonton acara TV sing nuduhake awake dhewe proses utawa pengalaman ing ngendi awake dhewe ora bakal ngeloni utawa nganggo wawasan kasebut. Awake dhewe ora bakal mbongkar mobil, mbangun pancuran ing latar mburi omahe dhewe, lunga menyang Peru kanggo mariksa jugrugan kuno, utawa model ulang omahe tangga.
mt: Learning is modern, for testing freedom from absolute. There is no good way to learn. In general, there is no one thing that can be learned. We learn from experience between teacher and student and the knowledge presented. Our experience now with all presentations about self-making and description, TV shows based on childhood drawing this. Many of your own watching TV shows that show your own process or experience where you will not follow or use that knowledge. You will not break down a car, build a fountain in the backyard of your own home, go to Peru to check an ancient bridge, or remodel a staircase.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: Gangguan turu iku proses sing sengaja nangekake nalika wayah turu normal sampeyan lan bali turu maneh ora sawetara wektu (10-60 menit) Iki bisa ditindakake kanthi gampang kanthi nggunakake jam beker sing rada amleng sing bisa gawe sampeyan sadar tanpa tangi nganti kaget. Yen sampeyan nemokake awake sampeyan ngatur ulang jam ing tilem sampeyan, iku bisa dipapanake ing sisih liya kamar, meksa sampeyan tangi saka panggonan kanggo mateni iku. Pilihan adhedhasar bioritme liyane yaiku ngombe banyu akeh (utamane banyu utawa teh, dikenal minangka kanggo wetokake akeh uyuh) sadurunge turu, meksa wong tangi kanggo nguyuh.
mt: This is a deliberate process of waking up when your normal sleep cycle has you waking up and going back to sleep again not too long (10-60 minutes) after. This can be easily accomplished by using a slightly delayed alarm clock that will wake you up without startling you. If you find yourself resetting the alarm clock in your room, you can place it on the other side of the room, forcing you to get up to turn it off. Other biorhythm based options are drinking a lot of water (especially water or tea, known as for waking up a lot of roosters) before going to sleep, forcing people to get up to pee.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Sawetara wong percaya menawa ngalami ngimpi jelas kang diinduksi kanthi gaweyan asring bisa marakake kesel. Alesan utama fenomena iki minangka asil kondisi impen sadhar sing njembarake dawane wektu ing antarane kondisi REM. Kanthi REM sing luwih sithik saben wengine, kahanan iki ing ngendi sampeyan ngalami turu temenan lan awak sampeyan leren dadi cukup arang kanggo dadi masalah. Iki padha kesele kaya-kaya sampeyan nglilir saben rong puluh utawa telung puluh menit lan nonton TV. Asile gumantung saka asringe utek sampeyan ngimpi kanthi jelas saben wengi.
mt: Some believe that experiencing lucid dreams induced by frequent awakenings can cause insomnia. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of REM sleep deprivation. With less REM sleep each night, this condition where you are sleeping soundly and your body is relaxed enough to be a problem. It is like you are walking every thirty or forty minutes and watching TV. The results depend on how often your brain dreams clearly every night.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: Regu virtual duwe pathokan keunggulan sing padha karo regu konvensional, nanging ana beda sing ora ketara. Anggota tim virtual asring dadi titik kontak kanggo klompok fisik langsunge. Dheweke asring duwe otonomi luwih tinimbang anggota regu biyasa amarga regune bisa ketemu karo macem-macem tlatah wektu sing bisa uga ora dingerteni karo pangurus enggonan. Anane “tim ora katon” sing temenan (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) uga komponen sing unik saka tim virtual. Tim sing ora katon yaiku tim manajemen sing saben anggotane laporan. Tim sing ora katon netepake standar kanggo saben anggota.
mt: Virtual teams have advantages similar to conventional teams, but there are differences. Members of virtual teams are often the point of contact for physical groups. They often have more autonomy than regular team members because they can meet in different places at different times that may not be known to the local manager. The "invisible team" concept (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of virtual teams. An invisible team is a management team where each member reports. Invisible teams are kept to standards for each member.
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: Regu virtual duwe pathokan keunggulan sing padha karo regu konvensional, nanging ana beda sing ora ketara. Anggota tim virtual asring dadi titik kontak kanggo klompok fisik langsunge. Dheweke asring duwe otonomi luwih tinimbang anggota regu biyasa amarga regune bisa ketemu karo macem-macem tlatah wektu sing bisa uga ora dingerteni karo pangurus enggonan. Anane “tim ora katon” sing temenan (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) uga komponen sing unik saka tim virtual. Tim sing ora katon yaiku tim manajemen sing saben anggotane laporan. Tim sing ora katon netepake standar kanggo saben anggota.
mt: Virtual teams have advantages similar to conventional teams, but there are differences. Members of virtual teams are often the point of contact for physical groups. They often have more autonomy than regular team members because they can meet in different places at different times that may not be known to the local manager. The "invisible team" concept (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of virtual teams. An invisible team is a management team where each member reports. Invisible teams are kept to standards for each member.
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: Teori konten dadi pusat kanggo nemokake apa sing ndadekake wong milih utawa narik kawigaten. Teori kasebut nuduhake menawa uwong duwe kabutuhan lan/utawa kepinginan tartamtu sing uwis diinternalisasi nalika dheweke mlebu mosok diwasa. Teori-teori iki ngamati ana apa karo wong-wong tartamtu sing marakake dheweke kepengin apa sing dilakoni lan apa perkara ing lingkungne sing bakal marakake dheweke kanggo nglakoni utawa ora nglakoni tumindak tartamtu. Loro teori isi sing misuwur yaiku Teori Kebutuhan HIerarki Maslow lan Teori Faktor Loro Hertzberg.
mt: Content theory is centered on finding out what makes people choose or reject attention. The theory states that people have certain needs and/or desires that are internalized when they enter adulthood. Theories of this sort observe what certain individuals are motivated to do and what factors in their environment will motivate them to do or not do certain actions. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Herzberg's Two Factor Theory.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: Aturan kaping telu sing paling asring-dilecehke iku panduan sing sederhana nalika nyiptakake dinamisme kanthi uga njaga rasa tertib ana njero gambar. Iki nuduhake menawa papan sing paling efektif kanggo subyek utama yaiku ing persimpangan garis sing mbagi gambar dadi telu kanthi vertikal lan horisontal (delok contone).
mt: The most frequently violated rule is the simple guideline when creating dynamics while also maintaining order within the image. It shows that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into three with vertical and horizontal (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: Tuladhane, format potograpi gambar mati sing umum ing donya yaiku 35mm, ing ngendi iku ukuran film sing dominan ing pungkasane jaman film analog. Iku isih diprodhuksi dina iki, nanging sing luwih penting rasio aspek wis diwarisake dening format sensor gambar kamera digital. 35mm iku arupa sejatine, rada bingung, ambane 36mm lan 24mm. Tentandhingan aspek format iki (kaperang kanthi rolas kanggo ngasilake tetandhingan angka sing paling prasaja) mula saka iku disebutake 3:2. Format kang luwih umum (contone, format saka kaluwarga APS) iku padh utawa nyedhaki rasio aspek iki.
mt: 35mm is the most common still photography film format in the world, and is still produced today, but the aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera sensor formats. 35mm is actually 36mm wide and 24mm high. The aspect ratio of this format (expressed as a ratio for the sake of simplicity) is 3:2. The more common (consumer) APS family of formats are the same or close to this aspect ratio.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: Kakurangane lensa kanggo nggedhekake yaiku karuwetan fokus lan jumlah elemen lensa sing dibutuhne kanggo ngentukne kisaran dawane fokus iku luwih gedhe tinimbang kanggo lensa utama. Iki dadi sethithik perkara nalika pabrik lensa entuk standar sing luwih dhuwur sajrone ngasilake lensa. Iki gawe lensa zoom bisa gawe gambar sing apik sing bisa dibandhingke karo lensa sing dawane fokus tetep. Kapitunan liya saka lensa zoom iku menawa celah maksimal (kecepatan) saka lensa iku biasane luwih rendah. Iki nggawe lensa zoom rega murah angel digunakake ing kahanan cahya sing sithik tanpa sumunar.
mt: The shortcomings of zoom lenses are the difficulty of focusing and the number of lens elements required to achieve the focus range, which is greater than that of the main lens. This is a significant issue when lens factories are required to meet higher standards in producing lenses. This makes zoom lenses less expensive than fixed focal length lenses used in low light situations without flash.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: Mistisisme yaiku nggayuh sesrawungan karo, identitas karo, utawa karumangsan kasunyatan sing dhuwur, ketuhanan, bebener rohani, utawa Tuhan. Para panganut ngupaya pangalaman langsung, gruneking ati, utawa wawasan babagan kasunyatan/dewa utawa dewa-dewa. Para pandherek nguyak cara-cara urip tertamtu, utawa latihan sing dikarepake kanggo ngrumat pengalaman-pengalaman. Kapercayan klenik bisa dibedhakake saka bentuk liya saka kapercayan agama lan pangibadahan kanthi penekanane marang pengalaman dhewe langsung saka kahanan kesadharan sing mbedani, utamane karakter sing ayem, duwe wawasan, tentrem, malah uga nyenengake.
mt: Mysticism is the attainment of union with, identity with, or communion with, a higher reality, God, the Absolute, or the divine. Believers seek direct experience, gnosis, or insight into truths which transcend the abilities of reason. Certain forms of life, or practices are recommended, or training believed to facilitate such experiences.  Mystical beliefs can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on direct personal experience, especially of a transcendent character, including such qualities as awe, wonder, bliss, rapture, and peace.
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: Kanggo wektu sing suwe sasuwene abad kaping sangalas lan rongpuluh, iku dipercaya warga sepisan ing Selandia Baru iku wong-wong Maori, sing mburu manuk raseksa sing diarani moas. Ajaran iki banjur netepake ide manawa wong-wong Maori pindah saka Polinesia ing Great Fleet lan njupuk Selandia Baru saka Moriori, dadi masarakat tetanen. Nanging, bukti anyar nuduhake yen Moriori minangka pepanthan dharatan Maori sing pindah saka New Zealand menyang Kapuloan Chatham, ngembangake kabudayan sing khas lan tentrem. Ana ing pulo Chatam uga ana suku liyane yaiku suku Maori sing ngalih saka Selandia Baru. Dheweke padha ngarani dheweke dhewe Moriori ana sawetara paprangan cilik lan ing pungkasane, Moriori musnah.
mt: For centuries, the people of New Zealand were believed to be the Maori, who hunted the now-extinct moa birds. This belief was later reinforced by the idea that the Maori came from Polynesia in the Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, a farming people. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a land-based Maori people who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing a unique and distinct culture. There were also other Maori tribes on the Chatham Islands. They called themselves Moriori, there were some small skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: Origami Pureland yaiku origami kanthi wates mung saklempitan sing oleh dilakoni saben wektu, lempitan kang luwih ruwet kaya lempitan walik ora diolehne, lan kabeh lempitan duwe panggonan sing langsung. John Smith ngembangke nalika taun 1970an kanggo nulung berkas tanpa pengalaman utawa wong-wong sing nduweni watesan katrampilan motorik.
mt: Origami Pureland is origami with only one fold performed each time, a more complicated fold like a half-fold is not performed, and all folds have a direct location. John Smith developed it in the 1970s to help files without experience or people with motor skill limitations.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: Kabudayan Lembah Indus iku kabudayan Jaman Perunggu ning anak benua India sisih lor kulon kalebu nganti-saiki. Pakistan lan daerah-daerah ing wilayah iki lan uga Afganistan sisih lor wetan. Kasusilan megar ing cekungan Kali Indus lan mula jenenge dijupuk. Sanadyan ana ahli sing ngira-ngira yen wiwitane kabudayan uga ana cekungan saka Kali Saraswati sing saiki garing, kudune kuwi diarani kanthi cetho Kabudayan Indus-Saraswati, nanging ana uga sing ngarani Kabudayan Harappan dijukuk saka Harappa, sing diduduk kaping pisan saka panggonan liyane taun 1920an.
mt: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilization in South Asia, dating from the 33rd century BCE. It flourished in the basins of the Indus River, which flows through the length of Pakistan, and along a system of inland waterways. It extended from northeast Afghanistan to Pakistan and the western states of India. The civilization is named for the Indus River, which flows through the length of Pakistan and along which the majority of the sites were located. The Indus Valley Civilization was one of the largest early urban civilizations, and one of the world's first state-level civilizations. It is also called the Harappan Civilization after the type site, Harappa, the first of its sites to be discovered and investigated. The Indus Valley Civilization was one of the largest early urban civilizations, and one of the world's first state-level civilizations. It is also called the Harappan Civilization after the type site, Harappa, the first of its sites to be discovered and investigated.
ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: Rasa serakah lan pengin menang dhewe iku bakal mesthi ana ning njero awake dhewe lan iki dadi sipat kanggo makarya bareng yaiku yen kita wis nduweni kabeh kauntungan gedhe isih ana akeh banget sing bisa jukuk kanthi cepet nalika nduweni rasa kepingin menang dhewe. Muga-muga akeh wong ngerteni manawa pilihan jangka dawa paling apik yaiku makarya kanthi bebarengan.
mt: Greed and the desire to win alone will always be inside you and this is a trait to work together if we have all the big profits still a lot can be cheated quickly when having a desire to win alone. Hopefully many people know that the best long-term choice is to work together.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: Biaya perang saka imperialisme Amerika ing penaklukan Filipina dibayar dening wong Filipino dhewe. Dheweke dipeksa mbayar pajeg ing pamrentahan kolonial A.S. kanggo mbeyani blanja negara sing akeh lan bunga obligasi ngambang angge jenengb pamrentah Filipina liwat omah bank Wall Street. Mesthi wae, untung gedhe sing asale saka eksploitase sing suwe marang wong Filipina bakal dadi keuntungan dhasar saka imperialisme Amerika.
mt: The cost of American imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines was paid by the Filipinos themselves. They were forced to pay taxes to the colonial American government to support the lavish spending of the American government and the interest on floating bonds named after the Philippine government through the house of Wall Street banks. Nevertheless, the great profits from the long exploitation of the Filipinos would become the basic profit of American imperialism.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: Kanggo ngerteni Templars, wong kudu ngerti kahanan sing nyurung kanggo nggawe tatanan kasebut. Jaman nalika anane kadadean-kadadean biasa diarani Jaman Pertengahan Dhuwur wayah ing sejarah Eropa ing abad ke 11, 12, lan 13 (AD 1000-1300) Pertengahan Abad Dhuwur didhisiki kanthi Wiwitan Abad Pertengahan lan disusul kanthi Pungkasan Abad Pertengahan, sing miturut konvensi pungkasan watara 1500.
mt: To understand the Templars, one must understand the circumstances that led to their creation. The era in which the events took place is commonly referred to as the High Middle Ages, a period in European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000-1300) The High Middle Ages is preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, according to the latest convention, around 1500.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: Sipat militer kerajaan Roma ditulungi dening carane nggedekake kasihatane. Dokter-dokter wiwit direkrut dening Kaisar Augustus lan bahkan mbentuk Kesatuan Medis Romawi kang sepisan kang dinggo sawise perang. Ahli bedhah duwe kawruh babagan maneka warna obat pengurang nyeri kalebu morfin saka ekstrak wiji apiun lan skopolamin saka wiji herbana. Dheweke dadi ahli amputasi kanggo nylametake pasien saka sel sing mati uga kaya turniket lan klem arteri kanggo mbendhung getih sing mlaku. Luwih saka sawetara abad, kerajaan Roma mimpin menyang panemon kang gedhe ing babagan obat lan mbentuk akeh saka wawasan kang awake dhewe ngerteni saiki.
mt: Military medicine was advanced by the Roman Empire's ability to transport the wounded. Doctors were recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the Roman Medical Corps, which was used after battles. Surgeons knew about a variety of painkillers including morphine from poppy seed extract and scopolamine from herbal seeds. They were experts in amputation to save patients from dying tissue as well as tourniquets and artery clamps to stop bleeding. For more than several centuries, the Roman Empire led in the development of medicine and formed many of the concepts we understand today.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: Sipat militer kerajaan Roma ditulungi dening carane nggedekake kasihatane. Dokter-dokter wiwit direkrut dening Kaisar Augustus lan bahkan mbentuk Kesatuan Medis Romawi kang sepisan kang dinggo sawise perang. src: Pandhangan, utawa kakuwatan kanggo ndeleng gumantung marang organ sistem sensor pandhangan utawa mata. Ana akeh susunan mata, kang beda-beda, wiwit saka karuwetan gumantung karo kabutuhan makluk. Pambangunan sing beda-beda duwe macem-macem katrampilan, preduli marang dawane gelombang sing beda-beda lan duwe tingkat kalandhepan sing beda-beda, uga mbutuhake pangolahan sing beda kanggo ngerteni macem-macem input lan nomer supaya bisa digunakake kanthi apik.
mt: Vision, or the ability to see, depends on the functioning of the visual system or eyes. There are many different eye designs, ranging from the simplest, such as those of the larvae of some jellyfish, to the most complex, such as those of humans. Different designs have different abilities, respond to different ranges of wavelengths of light, and have different levels of sensitivity, as well as different processing requirements to interpret the various inputs and numbers so that they can be used effectively.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: Sikhisme kuwi agama saka anak benua India. Asline kabentuk ana ing daerah Punjab ana abad 15 saka anane rasa ora seneng ing njero tradisi agama Hindu. Sikh nganggep imane dheweke padha dadi agama sing kapisah saka agama Hindu sanajan dheweke padha ngakoni iku sumber-sumber lan tradhisi-tradhisi Hindu. Para sikh ngarani agamane Gurmat, yaiku tembung Punjabi kanggo “dalane guru”. Guru iki asepek dhasar saka kabeh agama ing India nanging Sikhisme nganggep kuwi penting sing mbentuk inti saka kepercayaane sikh. Agama iki diadegaké ing abad ka-15 dening Guru Nanak (1469-1539). Ing kana disusul ing sanga guru sabanjure.
mt: Sikhism is a religion of the Indian subcontinent. It was founded in the 15th century in the Punjab region by Guru Nanak (1469-1539). It is based on the teachings of Guru Nanak and nine subsequent gurus, and is incorporated in the holy book Guru Granth Sahib. Sikhism is a monotheistic religion. Sikhism is the fifth-largest organized religion in the world, with approximately 23 million adherents. It is the majority religion in the Indian states of Punjab and Haryana, and in the Indian union territory of Chandigarh. In the United Kingdom and the United States, Sikhism is the dominant religion practised by people of Indian origin. Sikhism is the dominant religion in the Canadian province of British Columbia. Sikhism is also practised by large numbers of people in the Indian states of Delhi, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir, and in the Indian union territories of Daman and Diu and Dadra and Nagar Haveli. Sikhism is also practised by large numbers of people in the United States, the United Kingdom, Canada, Malaysia, Singapore, Thailand, Australia, New Zealand, and in East Africa. Sikhism is also practised by large numbers of people in the Indian states of Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Orissa, West Bengal, Assam, Tripura, and in the Indian union territories of Lakshadweep and Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Sikhism is also practised by large numbers of people in the Indian states of Gujarat, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and in the Indian union territory of Puducherry. Sikhism is also practised by large numbers of people in the Indian states of Jharkhand, Odisha, and in the Indian union territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Sikhism is also practised by large numbers of people in the Indian states of Arunachal Pradesh, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, and in the Indian union territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Sikhism is also practised by large numbers of people in the Indian states of Meghalaya, Sikkim, and in the Indian union territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Sikhism is also practised by large numbers of people in the Indian states of Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and in the Indian union territory of Andaman
ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: "Cacad Kakurangan Perhatosan ""minangka sindrom neurologis sing telung gejala klasik kalebu impulsif, reribed, lan hiperaktif utawa tenaga sing luwih-luwih"". Iki menawa dudu ora bisa sinau, iku reribed sinau; iku ""mangaruhi 3 nganti 5 persen saka kabeh bocah, bisa uga ana 2 yuta bocah-bocah Amerika"". Bocah kanthi ADD susah kanggo fokus marang perkara-perkara kaya tugas sekolah, nanging bocah kuwi bisa konsentrasi menyang perkara sing seneng dilakoni kaya dolanan game utawa nonton kartun kasenengane utawa nulis ukara tanpa tandha. Bocah-bocah kasebut ndhoyong ngalami akeh masalah, amarga ""nduwe tumindak pituna, gelut, lan nantang panguwasa"" kanggo ngrangsang utek, amarga uteke ora bisa dirangsang dening cara biyasa. ADD mangaruhi sambungan karo kanca-kanca liyane amarga bocah liya ora ngerti geneya dheweke tumindak kaya ngono utawa geneya dheweke ngeja kaya ngono apa utawa dheweke duwe tingkat kadiwasan sing beda."
mt: "ADHD is a neurobiological disorder with three classic symptoms including impulsivity, hyperactivity, and inattention or distractibility." This is not something that can be taught, it is "affects three to five percent of all children, possibly two million American children." Children with ADD have difficulty focusing on things like schoolwork, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing video games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing stories without punctuation. These children experience many problems because they have "aggressive, disruptive, and challenging behaviors" to stimulate their brains, because their brains cannot be stimulated in the usual way. ADHD affects relationships with other children because other children do not understand why they behave that way or why they write like that or they have a different level of risk."
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: Nalika pasinaon adhedhasar proyek kudune gawe pasinaon luwih gampang lan luwih narik, perancah sejangkah luwih adoh. Scaffolding dudu cara sinau nanging pitulung sing menehi dhukungan kanggo tiyang sing duweni pangalaman anyar sinau kayata nggunakake program komputer anyar utawa miwiti proyek anyar. Perancah bisa dadi virtual lan nyata, kanthi tembung liya, guru minangka bentuk perancah nanging uga paperclip cilik sing ana ing Microsoft Office. Perancah Virtual diinternalisasi ing piranti lunak lan ditujokake kanggo takon, njaluk, lan nerangake tata cara sing bisa nantang murid supaya bisa nangani dhewe.
mt: When training based on a project, scaffolding makes learning easier and more engaging. Scaffolding is not learning itself but support for those new to learning such as using a new computer program or starting a new project. Scaffolding can be virtual and real, with other words, a teacher is a form of scaffolding but also a small paperclip in Microsoft Office. Virtual scaffolding is internalized in software and aimed at asking, requesting, and explaining ways that can challenge students to do it themselves.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: MySpace minangka tapak web paling misuwur nomer telu sing digunakake ing Amerika Serikat lan saiki duwe 54 yuta lelakon. Akeh banget sing nggatekke situs web iki, utamane kanggo sinau. Ana aspek positif kanggo situs web iki, sing kalebu, bisa ngatur latar kelas kanthi gampang sing uga kalebu blog, video, poto, lan liya-liyane. Halaman iki bisa gampang dileboni kanthi mung menehi siji tetenger web, sing gampang dieling-eling lan gampang diketik kanggo murid sing bisa kangelan nggunakake papan ketik utawa nganggo tatananing panulis. Iku bisa dijumbuhake kanggo gawe iki gampang diwaca lan uga kanthi saakeh utawa sethithik werna kaya sing dipingini.
mt: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and now has 54 million users. Many people use this website, especially to learn. There are positive aspects to this website, including, it can easily arrange class levels with ease that also includes blog, video, photos, and others. This page can easily be searched with just one web address, which is easy to remember and easy to type for students who can struggle using a keyboard or using the author's style. It can be made easy to read and also with the same or as little color as desired.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: Nanging, ing Juni 1956, janji-janji Krushchev diuji nalika karusuhan ing Polandia, ing ngendi para buruh protes babagan kakurangan pangan lan sudane opah, malih dadi protes umum ngelawan komunisme. Sanadyan ing pungkasane, Krushchev ngirim tank kanggo mbalekne kahanan, dheweke nyerah karo sawetara panjalukan ekonomi lan setuju kanggo nunjuk Wladyslaw Gomulka sing misuwur dadi perdana menteri anyar.
mt: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were tested when riots in Poland, where workers protested about food shortages and strikes, turned into general protests against communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he gave in to some economic demands and agreed to appoint Wladyslaw Gomulka, a well-known former first secretary, as the new prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: Jerman iku mungsuh bebarengan ing perang Donya 2, marakake kerjasama antarane Uni Soviet lan Amerika Serikat. Karo pungkasane perang, bentrokan sistem, proses lan budaya marakake negara-negara rubuh. Kanthi pungkasan perang rong taun kepungkur, mantan sekuton saiki dadi mungsuh lan Perang Dingin diwiwiti. Iki bakal ana nganti 40 tahun mengarep lan bakal diperjuangake kanthi temen, dening tentara sing kuasa, ing medan perang saka Afrika tekan Asia, Afganistan, Kuba lan akeh papan liyane.
mt: Germany was an ally in World War II, making cooperation between the Soviet Union and the United States. After the war, the conflict of systems, processes and culture made former allies enemies and the Cold War began. This would last for 40 years and would be fought with friends, by powerful armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: Sistem Saraf njaga homeostatis kanthi ngirim impulse saraf liwat sakabehane awak kanggo njaga ilining getih lancar kaya tanpa gangguan. Rangsangan saraf iki bisa disalurke kanthi cepet banget menyang awak sing bisa njaga awak saka anceman sing bisa nyerang awak.
mt: The nervous system maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses throughout the body to keep the blood flowing like without interruption. These nerve impulses can be sent quickly to the body to keep the body from danger that can attack the body.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: Piramida Agung ing Giza minangka salah sawijining pitu kaelokan sing isih ana nganti saiki. Dibangun dening wong Mesir ing abad kaping telu SM, Piramida Gedhe yaiku salah siji saka sakehing struktur piramida sing dibangun kanggo ngurmati Firaun sing wis mati. Dataran dhuwur Giza, utawa “Giza Necropolis” ing Lembah Mati Mesir duwe sawetara piramida (ing ngendi piramida agung iku sing paling gedhe), sawetara makam cilik, sawetara candhi, lan Sphinx sing gedhe. Piramida gedhe digawe kanggo ngurmati Firaun Khufu, lan akeh piramida sing luwih cilik, makam, lan kuil dibangun kanggo ngurmati garwa lan kaluwargane Khufu.
mt: The Great Pyramid at Giza is one of the seven wonders of the world still standing. Built by the Egyptians in the third millennium BC, the Great Pyramid is one of several large pyramids built to honor dead pharaohs. The Giza Plateau, or “Giza Necropolis” in the Egyptian desert has several pyramids (the Great Pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the Great Sphinx. The Great Pyramid was built to honor Pharaoh Khufu, and several smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor his wives and family.
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: Piramida Agung ing Giza minangka salah sawijining pitu kaelokan sing isih ana nganti saiki. Dibangun dening wong Mesir ing abad kaping telu SM, Piramida Gedhe yaiku salah siji saka sakehing struktur piramida sing dibangun kanggo ngurmati Firaun sing wis mati. Dataran dhuwur Giza, utawa “Giza Necropolis” ing Lembah Mati Mesir duwe sawetara piramida (ing ngendi piramida agung iku sing paling gedhe), sawetara makam cilik, sawetara candhi, lan Sphinx sing gedhe. Piramida gedhe digawe kanggo ngurmati Firaun Khufu, lan akeh piramida sing luwih cilik, makam, lan kuil dibangun kanggo ngurmati garwa lan kaluwargane Khufu.
mt: The Great Pyramid at Giza is one of the seven wonders of the world still standing. Built by the Egyptians in the third millennium BC, the Great Pyramid is one of several large pyramids built to honor dead pharaohs. The Giza Plateau, or “Giza Necropolis” in the Egyptian desert has several pyramids (the Great Pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the Great Sphinx. The Great Pyramid was built to honor Pharaoh Khufu, and several smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor his wives and family.
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: Kuil Artemis ing Ephasus dirusak ing 21 Juli, 356 SM ing sajroning tumindak pembakaran sing ditindakake dening Herostratus. Miturut crita, dedelan kasebut pancen terkenal kanthi beya pira wae. Wong efesus, sing nesu, ngumumake yen jeneng Herostratus ora tau dicathet. Ahli sejarah Yunani Strabo banjur nyathet jenenge, sing kita kenal saiki. Candhi kuwi dirusak nalika Alexander Agung lair wengi kae. Alexander, minangka raja, nawarne kanggo mbayar mbangun kuil maneh, nanging tawarane ditolak. Banjur sakwise Alexander mati, kuile dibangun maneh ing 323 BCE.
mt: 21 July, 356 BC, the Temple of Artemis in Ephesus was destroyed in a fire set by Herostratus. According to legend, the man was infamous for his wealth. The Ephesians, enraged, vowed that the name of Herostratus would never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which we know today. The temple was destroyed on the night Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was refused. After Alexander's death, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BC.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: Wiwitan kendharaan sing dikenal iku mlaku, manungsa wiwit mlaku jejeg rong yuta taun kapungkur kanthi njedhule Homo Erectus (ateges manungsa sing mlaku jejeg). Para leluhure, Australopithecus ora mlaku kanthi jejeg saben dinane. Pangkususan sikil loro ditemokake ing fosil Australopithecus saka 4,2-3,9 yuta taun kepungkur, sanajan Sahelanthropus bisa mlaku sikil loro kanthi cepet sajrone pitung yuta taun kepungkur.
mt: The first known vehicle was a walking one, man began walking upright two million years ago with the Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Ancestors, Australopithecus did not walk upright every day. Four-legged footprints were found in the fossils of Australopithecus from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus could walk on four legs quickly seven million years ago.
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: MIgunakake kapal kanggo mindhahake barang iku cara paling efektif kanggo mindhahake jumlah wong lan barang sing akeh nyebrang segara. Pagaweyan angkatan laut kanthi tradisional yaiku kanggo mesthekake yen negara sampeyan njaga kemampuan kanggo mindhahake wong lan barang-barang, nanging ing wektu sing padha, ngganggu mungsuh sampeyan supaya bisa mindhah wong lan barang-barange. Salah siji tuladha keri kang paling patut dicathet saka iki yaiku operasi militer Atlantik Lor kanggo Perang Donya II. Wong-wong Amerika nyoba mindhahake wong-wong lan bahan-bahan nyebrangi Samudra Atlantik kanggo nulungi Inggris. Kanthi wanci sing padha, angkatan laut Jerman, nggunakake prau-U, nyoba ngendhegke lakune. Upama Sekutu gagal, Jerman bisa uga bakal bisa ngalahake Inggris kaya dene sisa Eropa.
mt: The use of ships to transport goods is the most effective way to move large numbers of people and goods across the sea. Naval forces traditionally are used to ensure that your country has the ability to move people and goods, but at the same time, to harass your enemies so that they cannot move people and goods. One example of this is the Allied military operations in the North Atlantic during World War II. Americans tried to move people and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help the British. At the same time, the German navy, using U-boats, tried to stop the flow. If the Allies failed, Germany might have been able to defeat the British as the rest of Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: Panemon rodha sing nganggo ruji rodha bisa nggawe kreta bangsa Asiria luwih entheng, luwih cepet, lan luwih cawis kanggo mlayu luwih cepet tinimbang para prajurit lan kreta liyane. Panah saka busur silang bisa nembus klambi wesi saka prajurit saingan. Watara 1000 SM, wong-wong Assyria nepungake kavaleri sepisan. Kavaleri minangka bala sing tarung numpak jaran. Pelana isih durung ditemokake, saengga para kavaleri Asyur tarung ing jaran sing wuda.
mt: 1000 BC, Assyrian horsemen were faster, lighter and more agile than their opponents and their bows could pierce the iron mail of the enemy. Around 1000 BC, the Assyrians introduced cavalry. Cavalry was a mounted force. Saddles were not yet invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on bareback.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Suku Babilonia iki mbangun candhi utama kanggo dewa-dewane sing dianggep dadi omah dewa. Wong-wong bakal nggawa sesajen kanggo para dewa lan para pandhita bakal njajal kanggo ngurus marang kebutuhane para dewa iku liwat upacara-upacara utawa festival-festival. Saben candhi wis plataran candhi sing mbukak lan banjur panggon pangaoban batin mung bisa dileboni para imam. Kadhangkala menara kusus kang mbengkeluk piramida, sing diarani ziggurat, dibangun dadi bagean candhi. Perangan puncak menara iku papan perlindhungan khusus kanggo dewa.
mt: This civilization built the main temples for their gods, which they considered the gods' homes. People would bring offerings to the gods and priests would try to take care of the gods' needs through ceremonies or festivals. Each temple was surrounded by a wall and only the inner sanctum could be entered by the priests. Sometimes a special tower was built on top of the pyramid, called a ziggurat. The top of the tower was a special place of worship for the gods.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: Yo! Raja Tutankhamun, kadang kala diarani “King Tut” utawa “Anak Raja”, iku salah sawijine raja Mesir Kuno sing isih dikenal ana mangsa moderen iki. Sing nggumunake, dheweke ora dianggep penting banget ing jaman kuno lan ora dicathet ing ameh kabeh daptar raja. Nanging, nalika nemokake kuburan iki taun 1922 gawe dheweke dadi selebriti. Nalika akeh kuburan kuna sing ditemokake dijarah, kuburan iki ditinggal tanpa diganggu. Ameh kabeh barang sing dikubur karo Tutankhamun wis diawetne kanthi becik, kalebu ewonan artefak sing digawe saka logam mulya lan watu sing arang.
mt: Hey! King Tutankhamun, sometimes called "King Tut" or "Boy King", was one of the lesser-known kings of ancient Egypt still known in modern times. He was not considered very important in his own time and was not listed in any of the king lists. However, when this tomb was discovered in 1922 he became a celebrity. While many ancient tombs were plundered, this one was left undisturbed. All the objects buried with Tutankhamun were well preserved, including a vast number of artifacts made of precious metals and rare stones.
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: Kita kenal akeh politikus, ilmuwan, lan seniman. Mbok menawa wong sing paling misuwur saka budaya iki yaiku Homer, pujangga wuta legendaris, sing nyungsun rong karya gedhe sastra Yunani: Geguritan Iliad lan Odyssey. Sophocles lan Aristophanes isih dadi penulis naskah sing misuwur lan critane dianggep dadi salah sijine asil literatur donya sing paling apik. Wong Yunani misuwur liyane yaiku matematikawan Pythagoras, sing paling misuwur kanthi teori sing misuwur babagan sesambungane ing sisih maju telu siku-siku.
mt: We know many politicians, scientists, and artists. But the most famous person from this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two great works of Greek literature: the Iliad and the Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still well-known playwrights and are considered among the greatest literary works of the world. Other famous Greeks include mathematician Pythagoras, best known for his theory about the connection of the three sides of a triangle.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: Ing iklim anget saka Timur Tengah, griya iku ora patia penting. Akeh kaluwarga Ibrani sing uripe ana njabane wilayahe. Wanita nindakake mangsak ing latar; warung-warung iku namung bukak meja dagangan sing nyawang dalan. Watu digunakake kanggo mbangun griya. Ora ana alas gedhe ing dharatan Canaan, mula kayu iku larang banget.
mt: In the hot climate of the Middle East, this house is not very important. Many Hebrew families live in the suburbs of their homeland. Women do the cooking in the background; shops are only open with a display table facing the street. Stone is used to build the house. There is no large forest in the land of Canaan, so wood is very scarce.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
